tasks.task: Operating a bulldozer to move soil for field preparation.
subtasks: Sitting in the cab of the bulldozer and turning the keys to start the engine.
Adjusting the controls on the bulldozer to engage the hydraulic systems.
Guiding the bulldozer forward and backward to navigate around the field.
Using the blade on the bulldozer to scoop and move soil onto the required areas.
Regularly checking the blade's position and adjusting it as needed for efficient soil movement.
Ensuring that the soil is spread uniformly across the designated fields.

tasks.task: Preparing the field for planting by grading the soil.
subtasks: Observing the field's slope and identifying areas where earth needs to be moved to level the ground.
Verifying that the bulldozer's blade is set at the appropriate angle for cutting soil.
Operating the bulldozer's blade to cut into the soil as necessary to create a suitable seedbed.
Moving along the field's furrows, ensuring even soil removal and preparation.
Checking the field's grade after the initial pass to confirm proper leveling.

tasks.task: Planting corn rows in a prepared field.
subtasks: Ensuring the field is free from debris and obstacles that could impede planting.
Starting the corn planter and adjusting the depth and spacing settings according to seed requirements.
Loading the planter with corn seeds and verifying that the mechanism is functioning properly.
Moving the planter through the field, planting corn rows in straight lines.
Monitoring the planter's performance to ensure accurate spacing and proper seed placement.

tasks.task: Applying fertilizer to the corn rows.
subtasks: Selecting the appropriate fertilizer applicator for the crop type and field conditions.
Attaching the fertilizer applicator to the appropriate hitch on the planter or a separate machine.
Testing the applicator's settings to ensure the correct rate of fertilizer application.
Driving the machine along the rows, ensuring that the fertilizer is deposited uniformly between the planted seeds.
Adjusting the applicator as necessary to maintain even coverage across the field.

tasks.task: Operating a grain combine to harvest corn.
subtasks: Attaching the combine to the transport vehicle and adjusting the distance between them.
Starting the combine and verifying all systems are operational before beginning harvest.
Following the corn rows, operating the combine's header to sever the corn plants at the base.
Feeding the combine's auger to move the crop into the combine.
Adjusting the combine's threshing concave to match the moisture content and type of corn being harvested.
Monitoring the combine's cleaning system to ensure debris and chaff are properly separated from the kernels.
Checking the grain tank periodically to ensure capacity, and preparing the transport vehicle for grain.
Tailing the combine as it harvests, unloading the grain as needed into the transport vehicle.
Continuing harvest until all designated rows or the entire field have been harvested.

tasks.task: Transporting harvested corn to the storage facility.
subtasks: Driving the transport vehicle to the harvested field, ensuring a safe and efficient route.
Checking loading capacity and speed to maximize grain retention and minimize spillage.
Loading the grain tank to the specified capacity, ensuring not to exceed safe operating limits.
Securing the load to prevent shifting, adjusting the straps as needed.
Transporting the grain to the storage facility while adhering to speed limits and crop handling guidelines.
Parking at the grain bin area and disconnecting the transport vehicle from the combine, if applicable.
Safely unloading the grain from the transport vehicle and directing it into the storage bin.

tasks.task: Unloading the corn from the transport vehicle at the grain handling facility.
subtasks: Inspecting the vehicle's discharge mechanism to ensure proper functioning.
Opening the unloading doors on the transport vehicle and adjusting any chutes or spouts.
Starting the unloading process, verifying the flow of grain into the storage bin.
Monitoring the level of the grain in the bin to prevent overfill or uneven distribution.
Closing the unloading doors once the process is complete and securing any openings.

tasks.task: Screening and sorting the corn for storage or further processing.
subtasks: Setting up the corn screening equipment to remove debris, broken kernels, and other impurities.
Feeding the corn into the screening machine and monitoring the output for quality.
Separating the clean corn from materials that must be discarded or recycled.
Storing the cleaned corn in appropriate bins or moving it to further processing facilities.

tasks.task: Ensuring the storage facility's ventilation and temperature are optimal for corn preservation.
subtasks: Checking the temperature of the stored corn periodically to prevent spoilage.
Activating or adjusting ventilation systems as necessary to maintain dry conditions.
Checking for signs of mold, pests, or insects and taking action to address any issues.

tasks.task: Checking the balance of stored corn in the bins.
subtasks: Measuring the height and depth of corn in each bin to monitor inventory.
Assessing the weight of the corn based on volume and specific gravity.
Maintaining records of corn quantities and updating inventory levels accordingly.

tasks.task: Operating a bulldozer to move soil for field preparation.**
Preparing the field for planting by grading the soil.**
Planting corn rows in a prepared field.**
Applying fertilizer to the corn rows.**
Operating a grain combine to harvest corn.**
Transporting harvested corn to the storage facility.**
Unloading the corn from the transport vehicle at the grain handling facility.**
Screening and sorting the corn for storage or processing.**
Ensuring the storage facility's ventilation and temperature are optimal.**
Checking the balance of stored corn in the bins.**
